description: Borrowed from Latin narcissus, from Ancient Greek νάρκισσος (nárkissos), ultimately either from Pre-Greek  or related to νάρκη (nárkē).

entries.meaning: Any of several bulbous flowering plants, of the genus Narcissus, having white or yellow cup- or trumpet-shaped flowers, notably the daffodil
A beautiful young man, like the mythological Greek Narcissus
